Title.evidence: Neoadjuvant Chemoradiotherapy Plus Surgery vs. Surgery Alone for Locally Advanced Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter, open-label, phase 3 randomised controlled trial enrolled 451 patients

Participants.evidence: 451 patients with stage T1-4N1M0/T4N0M0 thoracic ESCC from eight centers in China

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to receive NCRT plus surgery or surgery alone

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the efficacy of neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy (NCRT) plus surgery versus surgery alone for long-term survival.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival (OS)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 224 patients were randomised to the NCRT group and 227 to the surgery group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The intention-to-treat analysis included all participants.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The NCRT group showed improved OS (hazard ratio [HR], 0.74; 95% CI, 0.57-0.97; P = 0.03) and DFS (HR, 0.60; 95% CI, 0.45-0.80; P < 0.001) compared to the surgery group.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were more frequent in the NCRT group, with 54.3% experiencing grade 3 or 4 hematologic toxic effects.
